page.title: 04RAGDALE CHURCH, LEICS.
page.content: The Church at Ragdale is dedicated to All Saints. It is a pretty little ironstone church, which has a small stone tower with a brick top, a nave, south aisle and south chapel and contains a few fragments of old oak. It also has a Victorian heraldic glass window, put in when the Church was restored in 1874, which illustrates the connections with the Shirley family in the sixteenth century. The Font is of Norman origin. In the churchyard there is a tall stone cross of some antiquity.
